page.title: 13A Farmer's Day
page.content: Mr Ross,the farmer gets up at 7.00am to start his daily chores.He starts by telling the workers what their chores are for today .The farmer feeds his calves and beds them with straw. Once this is done he goes round his fields to check the bigger cattle are alright. After this is done he goes for his breakfast and reads his mail.When he is finished he goes out to help the workers with what they are doing. Some things they may be doing are, fencing, cleaning ditches and drains, planting potatoes, sowing turnips, spread fertilizer, spraying for weeds etc.At noon they stop for an hour for their dinner .In the afternoon they finish what they were doing in the morning.Then at 5.00 pm they stop work for the day.After tea the farmer prepares for the next day.
